comments.body: I believe this is a breaking change for existing projects. Let's avoid that: please provide a default value for `T` (same also for the second interface below)

This typing is consistent with the whole of Meteor Mongo API typings already in place and was the last bit not typed. With the existing type definitions, interfaces, types and operations working with Mongo documents are typed directly to the proper document type, not to "a document type defaulting to something less well typed". Both observe and observeChanges functions receive their document type from the Cursor, which had been typed already by the standards of type definitions already in place. I do not think defaults should be put in there
Yes I guess you're correct. In this particular situation it should be fine.
